alert.note: Alert for Fergus; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:26PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Judith Basin and central Fergus Counties through 830 PM MDT... At 726 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from 11 miles southeast of Denton to 18 miles northeast of Moore to near Lewistown to 17 miles southwest of Roy. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Giltedge, Danvers and Hilger. This includes Highway 191 between mile markers 2 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for central Montana.
